Detailed Description

Functions to control Nitro Engine.

Define Documentation

#define NE_ClippingPlanesSet ( n,
f   )     NE_ClippingPlanesSetI(floattof32(n),floattof32(f))

Set near and far clipping planes.

Parameters:
n Near plane.
f Far plane.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum NE_AnimationTypes

Possible animation types.

Enumerator:
NE_ANIM_LOOP  When the end is reached jumps to the start.
NE_ANIM_ONESHOT  When the end is reached stops.
NE_ANIM_UPDOWN  When the end or start are reached, direction is reverted.

enum NE_SPECIAL_EFFECTS

Enum with the possible effects of NE_SpecialEffectSet().

Enumerator:
NE_NONE  None.
NE_NOISE  Noise.
NE_SINE  Waves.

enum NE_UPDATE_FLAGS

Arguments for NE_WaitForVBL().

Enumerator:
NE_UPDATE_API  Updates NE_API.
NE_UPDATE_ANIMATIONS  Updates animated models.
NE_UPDATE_PHYSICS  Updates the physics engine.
NE_CAN_SKIP_VBL  Allows Nitro Engine skip the VBL wait if CPU load is greater than 100.

Sets the debug handler where Nitro Engine will send debug information.

Parameters:
fn Handler function.

int NE_GetCPUPercent ( void   )  [inline]

Returns CPU usage percent.

You need to use NE_WaitForVBL() and set NE_HBLFunc() to HBL interrupt function for this to work.

bool NE_GPUIsRendering ( void   )  [inline]

Returns false if VCOUNT is between 192 and 213. If not, true.

If true, you should't load textures (during the game). If you try to load textures, there is a moment when the GPU can't access that data, so there will be glitches.

void NE_Process ( NE_Voidfunc  drawscene  ) 

Draws a 3D scene.

Parameters:
drawscene Pointer to a void function with the 3D scene.

void NE_ProcessDual ( NE_Voidfunc  topscreen,
NE_Voidfunc  downscreen 
)

Draws a 3D scene in each screen.

Parameters:
topscreen Pointer to a void function with the 3D scene of top sceen.
downscreen Pointer to a void function with the 3D scene of lower sceen.

void NE_SetConsoleColor ( u32  color  )  [inline]

Changes console text color.

Parameters:
color New color.

void NE_SpecialEffectNoiseConfig ( int  value  )  [inline]

Sets value for noise effect.

Parameters:
value Must be ((power of 2) - 1). Default is 15 (0xF).
Don't use it if the noise effect is paused, the effect won't be updated until it is unpaused.

void NE_SpecialEffectPause ( bool  pause  ) 

Pause/unpause special effect.

Parameters:
pause true/false for pause/unpause.

void NE_SpecialEffectSet ( NE_SPECIAL_EFFECTS  effect  ) 

Set special effect to 3D screen(s).

Parameters:
effect NE_NOISE/NE_SINE. 0 = Disable.

void NE_SpecialEffectSineConfig ( int  mult,
int  shift 
) [inline]

Sets values for sine effect.

Parameters:
mult Frecuency. Default is 10.
shift Amplitude. Default is 9. If you want a bigger wave, use lower numbers.

void NE_UpdateInput ( void   ) 

Updates input data for internal use. Use this if you are using NE_API or window system.

You have to call scanKeys() each frame for this to work.

void NE_Viewport ( int  x1,
int  y1,
int  x2,
int  y2 
)

Sets the part of screen which displays the 3D image and sets a new projection.

Parameters:
x1 (x1,y1) Down-left pixel.
y1 (x1,y1) Down-left pixel.
x2 (x2,y2) Up-right pixel.
y2 (x2,y2) Up-right pixel.
In dual 3D mode it is reseted in NE_ProcessDual, so you have to call it inside your drawing function.

After NE_2DViewInit() viewport is set to (0,0,255,191) for a while, in the next NE_Process() it will go back to what you set (in Dual 3D it goes to default values).

You can't set another viewport for 2D objects with this function as it changes the projection matrix, use glViewport(). This isn't saved anywhere, you will have to use it after NE_2DViewInit() every frame.

void NE_WaitForVBL ( NE_UPDATE_FLAGS  flags  ) 

Updates selected systems and waits for vertical blank.

Parameters:
flags Look at NE_UPDATE_FLAGS.
For example, NE_WaitForVBL(NE_UPDATE_API | NE_UPDATE_ANIMATIONS);

NE_CAN_SKIP_VBL allows the function skip the VBL wait if CPU load is greater than 100. You should use this if you don't need to load textures or do anything else during VBL. You have to set NE_HBLFunc() to HBL interrupt function for this to work.
